channel.title: Tutorial on How to get Music "Free" Legally (idk if this is allowed)
channel.description:
This may not be allowed, i did not bother to comb the rules though cause im in somewhat of a hurry.
Things needed: iMesh (bear with me, this software may not be the best but it's the only legit thing i found other than itunes where you have to pay for music) Audials Tunebyte (you can get this free as a demo but to be able to remove the copyright from the music you will need the full version, pm me if you want to know how unless the staff suggests otherwise)
Part1. Using iMesh. (There is no imesh premium crack so there will be SOME music off limits to a standard user) [size=18pt][font=arial]Register with FALSE information or else bots that use iMesh will try to steal your info. The next thing you will want to do is download all the music you want (or can find) before you 1 month regular membership expires in which you will no longer be able to download anything. Using iMesh is self explanatory therefore i will leave you to look around. Then you will need a premium version of tunebyte (or a serial number which i happened to purchase, and if the staff permits me to i will post).[/font][/size] Part2. Using Tunebyte. [size=18pt][color=green][font=arial]As soon as you have downloaded everything, use tunebyte to extract the dmi copyright lock which disables you from using the music on itunes. You will want to import the music from your directory that iMesh uses to place the music. What tunebyte will do for you is copy the music without the dmi lock, so it will take a while for it all to finish.[/font][/size] [i]That was simple right? I know it may be newfag-ish of me to post this but as soon as you see the benefits you will understand why you will want to do this. 1. The music is legal as stated in both iMesh's agreement and Tunebyte's. 2. There will be no restraint on the amount of music you can choose from over the 1 month you have iMesh. 3. Less waiting for illeagal downloads ect... 4. Better music quality and all the album artwork is there. 5. You will have a better peace of mind since you wont have to worry about fines and such associated with illegal activity.[/i]

item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

I usually download the music for free, but once in a while I like to have the real thing so I go out and by the cd itself.

coda.fm is a music torrenting database, it doesn’t have much but it has all the classics.

item.title: Tutorial on How to get Music "Free" Legally (idk if this is allowed)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Basically any method of acquiring music for free is illegal and this is no exception. I love how many people think downloading youtube videos is legitimate when it’s clear that saving any youtube video that intended to be streamed to the user is against their tos.

There’s so many ways of getting music these days and it’s mainly a matter of preference.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial on How to get Music "Free" Legally (idk if this is allowed)
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

www.isohunt.com

In the three years I’ve used it I’ve never come across an infected mp3 file, just don’t download zipped albums and you’ll be fine. And about your method being more high quality, that’s not true, if you know what to look for it’ll be just as good as itunes or any other good music shop.

Read full topic
